verbs.description: obsign (third-person singular simple present obsigns, present participle obsigning, simple past and past participle obsigned)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To seal; to confirm, as by a seal or stamp.
examples: He willeth us to eat of the bread  […]  and drink of that cup all,  […]  that is, take it as the sacrament of his body and blood  […]  whereby he doth represent, and to our faith give and obsign unto us, himself wholly, with all the merits and glory of his body and blood.
